However, China has implemented robust strategies for distancing control and quar-206 antine around this country, therefore, the recovery rate is 90%. Far away from New 207 York, with recovery rate of 9.42% and on the other hand, cities as Texas is 13.09%.
Besides, Hawaii has different rate of 56.79% for the restrictions initiated with more 209 influence in their population.

Combining a mathematical model with multiple datasets, Fig. 6 and Fig. 7 , we 211 found that the median daily Rt of COVID-19 in USA probably varied between 2.6 212 and 5.6 in April, 2020, before 3 weeks of travel restrictions were introduced. We In traditional methods, we detect mistakes in the forecast associated to old pan-269 demic researches, and as we can see, the COVID-19 has behaved in unpredictable 270 and changing ways, according to the factors used in its treatment. Therefore, we 271 think that the pandemic behaves as a dynamic-chaotic system, which sets new start-272 ing points that do not intersect and changes its behavior according to the way it 273 is treated. Consequently, this study could be a real contribution for understanding 274 this problem with a good tool of processing a systematic review. In the GPR analysis, forecast has detected three clusters, in the early days of March 225 2020, before quarantine, after quarantine actions during 2 weeks later and the last 226 cluster during the second week on April 2020. 227 Associated to the median Rt estimated during April for travel restrictions were 228 introduced, we estimated that a single introduction of COVID-19 transmission would 229 have a 30% to 34% probability of causing a large outbreak, Fig. 8. 230 In Fig. 8, the new contagion curve demostrated the maximum value on April 9 th 231 with 35,049 new contagion, after this day, the values have been lower. However, new 232 death peak will occur on 23 th with 3,202 deaths. Finally new recoveries will occur 233 the peak on August 19 th . 234 Some states as Wyoming, Utah, South Dakota and West Virgina have lower COVID-235 19 infections than other states. It requires verified if test has been done or if popu-236 lation has abided by all regulations associated to quarantine in a local level, as Fig. of GPR has an average Target Value of 0.9688312 with an inverted Co-239 variance Matrix with highest value of 0.9936848383. At the same time, the inverted 240 covariance matrix * Target-value Vector has highest value of 0.496957. 241 About the results of the model, they have a correlation coefficient of 98.91% and 242 relative absolute error 99.19 %. With the model associated to infections are described deterministic models, where the future is consider already fixed, and 246 knowing that in the past, many infections studies and physics phenomenon were 247 performed under the model mentioned, we agree that this is the common view-248 point to come away with. However, we think that in previous big scale studies as 249 pandemic physics, these equations have not demonstrated accuracy in the forecast 250 curves, since their behavior, never match in the space and this is because, for a long Reported cases by date of onset (blue points) and estimated USA cases from each state by date of onset (Yellow line) for new contagion, deaths and recovered patients.range of initial conditions, the system evolves in one state. Therefore, the traced 252 paths never intersect, since the pandemic responds to external stimulation in the 253 way that managed and, that is why establishes new starting points that do not ininFig. 9, the curves never form loops and consequently are not predictable,257    and this is where we see that small actions (for example government quarantines), 258 could dramatically change the behavior of the pandemic, and that is precisely what 259 has been observed in all countries, given that in each of them, the pandemic has 260 behaved in a different way, unpredictable and changing, according to the factors that 261 have been inferred in its treatment. Finally, the COVID-19 forecast, performed as 262 chaotic-dynamic system, has a good result than traditional models, because of the 263 sensitive dependence on initial conditions. It uses the Lorenz's system displayed, so 264 it seems like a paradox, where the system is both deterministic and unpredictable, 265 because, you could never know the initial conditions with perfect accuracy, : a) Dynamic representation, b) historical information c) forecast and evaluation in USA, Spain and Italy.

FIGREF13.text: diverge (e.g. Spain and Italy), due to the strategies implemented by the government 278 as quarantine, closed frontiers and more constraints. From being arbitrarily close 279 together, they end up on different trajectories; then, it demonstrates that depends 280 on initial conditions and the actions taken. In the equations described in the section281 2, there is nothing random at all about this system of equations, even if you could 282 input exactly the same initial conditions, you would get exactly the same result.283 ence in initial conditions, no matter how tiny, will variates the final state. 285 286 Finally, with almost the same initial conditions, the forecasts never release the same 287 evolution of the COVID-19 and it makes changes in the behavior. Hence, the infecis very difficult to evaluate if some state has implemented all the test re-292 quired, an assessment tieh fatality rate, recovery rate (Fig. 4 and Fig. 5), our data 293 evaluates that unreported or undetected cases are likely,especially in countries with 294 low HAQ index. In this research, we proposed timely short-term forecasts of the 295 cumulative number of reported cases of the COVID-19 epidemic in USA per states 296 as of January 21 th to April 12 th , 2020. As the epidemic continues, we have created 297 a new Bayesian system with GIS information available [6], the selected algorithms 298 for chaotic dynamic system is Reduced-Space Gaussian Process Regression with in-299 formation obtained in 82 days with continuous learning, day by day, the correlation 300 coefficient is 98.91%. This new model will recognize the new changes in the con-301 straints associated to COVID-19. Our analyses identified: May 11 th , the estimated 302 active patients will be 829,110 (peak), with 95,670 deaths and estimated contagion 303 1,066,549; likewise, July 14 th 21 2020, with a peak number of 132,074 death with 304 infected individuals of about 1,157,796 and a number of deaths at the end of the 305 epidemics of about 132,800 is a key date for new measurements associated to con-306 trol of this infections. Further studies are needed to investigate new government 307 restrictions or economic activation and more associated issues.
